reviewText: We finally get a live DVD of Live and the performance was worth the wait, but sadly the DVD falls a little bit short. The full set did not make it onto the DVD which is a shame. There is also very little bonus content. There are some minor lyric changes, but not a big deal. Still, this is a must have for any Live fan. The footage of the show is why you would buy it and they did a great job capturing the Live experience. The audio is great as well. I want to give it 5 out of 5 because the important things are here, but it doesn't quite deserve a perfect score.
Title: N/A

reviewText: It took a while to stumble onto this gem(have you ever done a search for 'live'?-good luck). I gather the band is continuing without Eddie now (but to me that's like Van Halen without David Lee Roth)so this will be about the best you'll get from a really good band.Excellent band,interesting,very intimate venue, & an audience that's really into it make this a really good show. Video editing can be a little frenetic at times, but that's a pretty common complaint. I thought it was a little strange that Ed's brother played guitar with them throughout the whole show but because he's not an official member he was totally ignored during the editing. You just kept getting glimpses of someone up there playing with them. You had to read the credits at the end to make sense of it.Just a little wierd.On the whole, two thumbs up
Title: N/A

reviewText: With little hesitation did I pre-order "Live At The Paradiso" when it was announced. I've been a fan of Live for fifteen years, so I was pretty excited to finally see a live DVD come out. After watching it several times, the only complaint I have is the quick-paced editing is a little too hectic at times. Also, it would have been nice to see "Mystery", "Run To The Water" and some other songs in the setlist. Other than that, it's a great DVD! "They Stood Up For Love" really comes to life in this format...

reviewText: All the right songs, beautiful set, it's Live ... What else can I say? ... Why is Ed's brother neglected on the concert?
Title: N/A

reviewText: I first saw LIVE at Philadelphia's Tower Theatre when promoting their first album... and have seen them several times since. Easily among my top five bands of all time. This DVD is very good quality, and the concert itself is brilliant! The venue was perfect - intimate and energized. The audience was super-charged, and that energy easily transfers to the viewer.One of the best concert films I've seen, and a must have for any LIVE fan.
Title: N/A

reviewText: shame on you live, we have been waiting 15 years for a full live "live" concert dvd, and you leave off one of the most powerful songs ever written in your repertoire????have been looking forward to this since it was announced you recorded both shows in Amsterdam, and then to find out you "cut/edit" out some of the showwhat a disappointment!!!!!
summary: please put "entire" show on here; how leave off run to the water?
